Name: protini polypeptide firming moisturizer
comments:
* Love this product. Noticed a difference in the hydration of my skin. My skin is definitely smoother. * I've gone through at least 5 regular containers and 2-3 minis in the last four years. It has become a go to product. It feels moisturizing even when I use strong cleansers, and I feel it improves the texture of my skin. * I have been using for over 5 years. I have tried a few other brands, but always come back to this one. I have senstive skin and this is one of the only mositruizers that has worked for me. 

My one complaint is with the refills. I have  had issues with fit and functioning of the original container. After replacing lotion, the dispenser stopped working. * I have been using this for a little over a month now. The PROS‚Ä¶ It feels amazing on my skin. My skin feels silky, soft and it feels incredibly hydrated. It also wears very well underneath makeup. The CONS‚Ä¶ it advertises that it helps with the appearance of skin tone, texture, and firmness. I have not noticed any difference in any of thsoe areas. CONCLUSION ‚Ä¶ if you're looking for a hydrating moisturizer that feels wonderful on your skin and works well with sensitive skin, this is a wonderful moisturizer for you. If you're looking for the benefits of improved tone, texture, and firmness, like it advertises, I would not recommend this moistureizer. * USE WITH CAUTION! 
I recently ordered a new one late October. For reference my last Protini was purchased July 2025.
I have no idea what happened but within hours of application my face became red, I woke up the next day and had small milia/whiteheads, all over my face and neck along with a lovely rash. Stopped using it immediately, reached out to the company to confirm any formula changes, to which they said there was none.
Returned the product but am still wondering what happened as I have been using this particular cream for years and never had an issue. 
If you plan to start using this cream or even get a new one, start using it when you have no important events coming up, just in case you have a reaction. * Love the product. Especially for my eyes but the pump jar did not work and allowed air to enter in a dry out/ evaporate the product. Also hard to pump from the jar as well. Had to unscrew top to get cream out! * Drunk elephant has the best products. This one is my favorite.

Name: confidence in a cream anti-aging hydrating moisturizer
comments: * [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I always had issues with dry skin; not anymore!! This cream is a game changer! I feel like it puts a barrier on my skin in a good way. It is soft and creamy.  It has a very light nice smell.  Anti-aging properties are light and slow working which is good.  Very hydrating, non irritating, and absorbs well. * [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I really liked this product. Feels like a nice little burst of hydration for my skin. Works well as a standalone moisturizer or as a base layer in my skincare and makeup routine. * This is the "It" product for this season! My skin tends to usually lean more towards combination T Zone in the fall/winter and oiler in the summer, however, with the drastic weather change this past week here in the south, where one day it is 70 degrees and the next it is 40 - and this cycle continues for weeks on end - my skin needed a bit more hydration. This It Confidence in a Cream was exactly what my skin needed! My skin loved it instantly! Although, I usually prefer a tube or pump style moisturizer for sanitary purposes, I did not mind the glass jar, as the scent was so delightful! By far, one of my favorite fresh scents in a moisturizer- not too fragrant or strong. The consistency of the cream was also just right, not too heavy and did not leave a residue behind. It melted into my skin right away and kept my skin feeling hydrated throughout the day/evening. The fact that this moisturizer also contained Anti Aging benefits was a major perk. I'm a big fan of WATER being the base ingredient, as well as niacinamide being in the top 3. Other anti aging ingredients listed as part of rejuvenating concentrate include Ceramides, hyaluronic acid, peptide-lipid complex and squalane - some of my favorites- all in one jar. So long as my skin continues to love this cream and does not breakout, I  will be repurchasing this cream once I run out! This cream was sent to me for review. * [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This product is a rich yet fast-absorbing cream. It provides great hydration and visibly improves fine lines, smooths, and firms due to its ingredients. It contains niacinamide, squalane, and peptides, making it a barrier-strengthening moisturizer that works for my combination skin. It really hydrates dry skin, providing a smooth makeup base, and reduces dullness and improves elasticity. I personally do not like the scent and would not buy again because of it. * I received this product in exchange for my honest review. As a licensed skin care professional, I am impressed with this moisturizer. It does not clog my pores, yet is heavy and nourishing. It's a great moisturizing for winter months and dry climates - soothing dehydrated skin. It has a luxurious, smooth texture but has a heaviness to it that is designed for nighttime application. A soft, pleasant scent that is not overwhelming or abrasive on my sensitive skin. It is not well suited for travel s it comes in a thick glass pot. * The It Cosmetics Confidence in a Cream Anti-Aging Moisturizer is my new favorite cream! I love how thick and moisturizing it is. It makes for a wonderful addition to any nighttime routine. I apply it right out of the shower and I can instantly feel my skin rehydrating the minute I rub it in. I've also noticed that my skin is much more plump. Since I started using this moisturizer, I've already purchased one for my mother and one for my mother-in-low. I will absolutely repurchase once I run out.

It doesn't take long for the moisturizer to settle and there is no residue or white cast, but it does peel when you wash it off which is a first for me. The moisturizer has a thick consistency, but is lightweight when applied. I have sensitive combination skin type and large pores if it helps anyone with same problem areas. * If you have oily skin, just try it. If you have combo skin ‚Äî it's even great just on the t-zone for oil control. That's what I do when the weather gets colder and i need more moisture in my dry areas. It's also nice under makeup (just make sure it dries properly). Tip: tap it on instead of rubbing it. * [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] It was good but to me wasn't great. I didn't like how strong the spf smell was it literally felt like o just put sunscreen on to go to the beach or pool. * So, I have super oily skin on my t-zone & large pores from years of acne as a teenager. I've done all the research, I mean I've literally done it all it feels like. Most recently I was using The Ordinary moisturizer, which felt nice upon application but within a few hours my face looked like I fried bacon on my forehead, like seriously. I'd have to literally wipe my forehead with my arm when no one's looking to remove the shine or go blot my forehead with a tissue... I'd be so embarrassed at work sometimes having meetings in conference rooms that have awful lighting & makes me look even shinier. I could go on... I've even considered buying blotting papers to carry in my purse, assuming this is just what I deal with. But I randomly purchased this La Roche Posay moisturizer one day after hearing my coworker talk about it who has similar oily/combo skin issues. This stuff is great for oily skin!!! There is a significant difference in the oiliness of my skin in the middle of the day after using this stuff! After washing my face, I apply a generous amount while my skin is still slightly damp. I rub it in, but not all the way, instead I start patting my face at the end and just allow the rest of the product to sit on my skin and soak in. I think it really matters using enough product and applying to slightly damp skin to avoid dryness & pilling. I've been using it for a little over a week now, worn under light makeup once, & I have not experienced any pilling as other reviews have mentioned. It also should be noted that I don't have a super lengthy skincare regime either... only a gentle facewash, eye cream & moisturizer, so I'm not sure how it would apply over serums and such. But again, APPLY TO SLIGHTLY DAMP SKIN & PAT ON SKIN TO FINISH. It makes all the difference, no matter what moisturizer you use! The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because I sometimes I apply a little extra around my chin/mouth since I don't get very oily there it can tend to feel a little tight like it needs more moisture. But after applying a little extra to that area it's fine. Hopefully this review helps other potential buyers with oily/combo skin not be too scared to give it a try because it really changed the game for me! I tend to get slightly drier skin in the winter around my nose, so we'll see how this product performs during that time soon, but it's already starting to get chilly out here & so far I am loving this product a lot.

Looking back at the date I started using this product "THE RICH CREAM" and doing the math I realized that this product causes rosacea-like symptoms. I was even flushing and sensitive to heat. Expose to the sun with this cream on was cooking my skin. Yes, I'm beating myself up, because I was actually thinking the whole time that this cream was helping me keep my skin moisturized at least. 

Here is the tricky part: not all my face broke out, felt hot or uncomfortable. My forehead, chin and nose were normal and moisturized by this cream. 

All symptoms were strong on the apple of the cheek (malar fat pad). Therefore, my dermatologist told me it was just rosacea.

Another tricky part; I didn't feel any stinging or burning immediately after applying. The symptoms were triggered with heat and moist. 

I can reasurre that the issue was this cream. I put it to test.

Name: countercontrol matte effect gel cream
comments:
* If you truly have oily skin, you know the difference in a review from someone with oily skin vs someone whos skin gets oily.  I have oily skin and probably spend upwards of $1K a year on products trying to find things that actually do as they claim, and this is one of them.

I was a little reluctant to purchase this as the price is pretty high for a brand I've never used, but I'm glad that I took the risk on it.  Prior to this moisturizer I was either using none at all (because most others just make me more oily, dont need redundant products on oily skin), or I was using the La-Roche Posay Toleriane Double Repair Matte one which didn't do much for me. Obviously how this will work for you is going to be different for everyone, and the other products you use prior to your moisturizer will make a difference as well.

For reference I am a 28 yr old female, white/Caucasian.  My morning routine is: wash with a clay based cleanser (Dermalogica), tone (Fenty Skin), hyperpigmentation serum (Good Molecules), niacinamide/zinc serum (Sunday Riley), then this moisturizer. The consistency of this product is great for oil as it is a gel based product, but it comes out more opaque white than clear which is fine. It does not have much of a fragrance that I have noticed, but I'm not sensitive to fragrance so I wouldn't be one to say. When I put this on it almost feels as if it is a crossover between a moisturizer and a makeup primer that blurs your pores.  Now it does not make your pores go away by any means, but it does HELP.  Immediately after applying my skin is definitely mattified but again, not completely shine free as if it is a primer with the sole purpose of making your skin look like it has powder on it. It does not make my skin feel tight and dried out, it genuinely makes me feel moisturized and smooth without the glowy look that normal moisturizers do. From my experience it definitely does not keep me matte for 8 hours, I would say after about 3-4 hours I start to see shine on my face to the point where I feel the need to blot if I were going out somewhere (this is all without wearing makeup or anything on top of my morning skin routine, I work from home).

If you truly have an oily/combo skin type this is not going to be your holy-grail product that makes all of your problems disappear (will continue to search for it), but if it is within your budget for a product of this type then this is 100% top 5 best moisturizers for oily skin on the market right now in my opinion after having used this for a few weeks now.  Would repurchase (and I rarely ever find products I do)!  

I also just want to throw out there that I did buy this on my own, was not asked/paid to write this, and I think this is either my only review I've ever written on Ulta or one of a few over a span of years that I don't even remember. * The packaging is very luxe but the pump feels like its empty and its still half full. It doesn't mattify anything but it is a nice mix of a gel and lotion and a lightweight moisturizer. This is an MLM and I do feel it's overpriced for what it is. It's pretty basic. * Matte effect that works great as a moisturizer/ primer for oily skin types

comments:

AMAZING * I do not usually have issues with retinol and I am always careful to use sunscreen and moisturize properly when I do. This broke me out into small scabby rashy areas on multiple areas of my face with itchiness. It's been four days and it's worsened each day. After reading recent reviews and seeing similar comments, I can only guess that the recent formula change is what made a seemingly well-rated product act so rough on my skin. * Every time I use this product, I wake up with cystic pimples on my jawline. After looking at the ingredients, I noticed this has caprylic/capric triglycerides in it- which is a derivative of coconut oil- known to be comedogenic. It also contains grape seed oil which also clogs pores along with a few other ingredients that are not acne-prone friendly. Additionally, the concentration of retinol in this is so small it really isnt going to make a difference on fine lines, so I can't justify continuing use of this. I switched to the retinol serum by the Inkey List which contains no comedogenic ingredients. * I used this retinol cream for nearly a year (and swore by it) and it worked well for my skin‚Äîuntil recently, when i could swear GM quietly changed the formula and packaging. Not only does the new version smell HORRIBLE, but it caused me to have a severe breakout and what I believe was an allergic reaction. My skin has never reacted this badly to a skincare product before and I know for a fact it is directly linked to using this cream.

It's really disappointing that such a reliable product was altered without any clear notice. The new tube looks different, the texture feels off, (and you can definitely tell by the smell) and unfortunately, the results are the complete opposite of what I experienced before. I won't be repurchasing, and I'd caution others who had success with the old formula to be very careful with this new one!!

I love this for my whole body. It is pretty thick, so a little goes a long, way especially for the face. * Amazing for dry skin * Finally a moisturizing cream that lasts longer than 24 hrs.   My skin loves this product. * I wanted to love this moisturizer, I really did.

I have really dry skin around my eye area (like red, itchy, raised/inflames, peeling skin around the eyes in the winter), normal on the lower half of my face, and oily on the forehead. So im definitely a combination skin type, and i had heard great things about vanicream, and my sister uses it, so when i first got into skincare, I thought it would be a good option.

This moisturizer is SO THICK. Unbelievably thick. And hard to spread. 

I do an oil cleanse routine, as i have a lot of sebaceous filaments and clogged pores but not too much acne issues. I would oil cleanse, and use my toner. At this point in my routine, i would feel like my pores were so clear and my face was so shiny.

Then, i would apply my vanicream, and it was like my 10 minutes of previous skincare didn't exist. It's like i was watching the moisturizer clog my pores back up.

It also feels like this moisturizer never soaks in. Any contact my face has with any object just seems to get slimy again from the moisturizer, which is a big issue seeing as i wear glasses constantly and a cpap at night. So im constantly pushing my glasses back up and cleaning off the bridge, and my cpap just leaks in the middle of the night with mask farts because the silicone is slicked with moisturizer, even if i applied it 3 yours before bedtime.

I will say, i havent had issues with dry skin around my eyes since i started using it. So if you dont care to minimize pores or get rid of your sebaceous filaments, and are mroe worried about treating intense dry skin, go for it. This is your moisturizer. Otherwise, its almost like youre ruining the entire purpose of your skincare.

comments: * Been using for years!  Absorbs quickly, feel light on my face, yet I see a consistency in my skin, meaning no new lines or wrinkles. If you have oily or sensitive skin, or dislike fragrance, consider other options. * L'Oreal Paris Revitalift Triple Power Face and Neck Moisturizer SPF 30 with Pro-Retinol, Vitamin C & Hyaluronic acid is perfectly packaged. Also, I'm an extremely sensitive skinned person that breaks out easily with some scents & comedogenic products. After several weeks of usage I did feel it smoothed my neck, however I did experience some breakouts on my face. I would probably use this product as more of a summertime SPF than a daily moisturizing cream. * 'LOreal Paris Revitalift Triple Power Anti-Aging Face Moisturizer, Pro Retinol, Hyaluronic Acid & Vitamin C to Reduce Wrinkles, Firm & Brighten Skin really does what it claims and MORE! I LOVE the versatility of this product and its light scent. This is one of my most favorite staples and I highly recommend L'Oreal Paris Revitalift Triple Power Anti-Aging Face Moisturizer, Pro Retinol, Hyaluronic Acid & Vitamin C to Reduce Wrinkles, Firm & Brighten Skin. I tried it with 6 different foundations, skin tints and bb creams and all of them resulted in the same terrible texture, clinging to dryness and imperfections. * I've struggled for a while with my roseaca and was on a mission to find something, and this helped right away. I noticed a huge difference in the first week. I go through my face routine with CeraVe facial soap and toner then follow up with this. If you haven't tried it yet I recommend 10000%. everyone's skin is different so it can be frustrating finding what works for your skin. * I started using La Roche-Posay face wash and moisturizer about 6 months ago, and has been great for my skin. My face is softer, less shiny, and my pores are smaller/less noticeable, but I still have some dry red spots on my cheeks. Even adding extra moisturizer doesn't help. I had high hopes for this product, but it was not a good fit for me. Despite the fact that green is supposed to cancel out red, the green really stood out on cheeks and I had to rub and rub and rub to try and get it to absorb and not be noticeable. Within about 10 minutes, my cheeks felt hot and dry, and I ended up wiping the product off with a cool, damp towel. The texture of the product was nice, and there was no scent, which I appreciated, but it just didn't work for me. * This has definitely calmed my rosacea flare at a fraction of the cost for products at the dermatologist and it fits in perfectly with my skin care routine * This is sold as a moisturizer but it definitely is not one. Definitely did more harm than help so I was really disappointed.

comments:
* It may not help the lines and aging affects on my fqc3 but the cream makes my face feel smooth, youthful and healthy. It may not be so but it feels good * I thought this was a great product and that the flushing on the neck and breakouts on the apple of my cheeks was due to rosacea. Nope. It was this cream. Under the sun with this cream it is even worse. 
Tricky part: not all my face was burning nor breaking out. And burning is not immediately after applying!
I stopped using this cream and my face is on its way to recovery. 
So, be aware. I read another comment stating kind of the same situation. I was actually going to reoder, but was curious about the 1 star reviews and finding "that especific comment" put an end to my nightmare. * I was going to reorder this product, but I was curious about the 1 star reviews and someone mentioned experiencing the same issues as me. 
Looking back at the date I started using this product "THE RICH CREAM" and doing the math I realized that this product causes rosacea-like symptoms. I was even flushing and sensitive to heat. Expose to the sun with this cream on was cooking my skin. Yes, I'm beating myself up, because I was actually thinking the whole time that this cream was helping me keep my skin moisturized at least. 

Here is the tricky part: not all my face broke out, felt hot or uncomfortable. My forehead, chin and nose were normal and moisturized by this cream. 

All symptoms were strong on the apple of the cheek (malar fat pad). Therefore, my dermatologist told me it was just rosacea.

Another tricky part; I didn't feel any stinging or burning immediately after applying. The symptoms were triggered with heat and moist. 

I can reasurre that the issue was this cream. I put it to test. 
I rarely leave reviews these days, but this whole situation was a nightmare to me and I hope I can help others. * One of my favorite products! * Light & fluffy ! comments: * I've purchased the original cloud cream numerous times! I love how hydrating that one is and how it sinks into my skin. It plays well with my makeup and doesn't cause breakouts. I'm 39, living in hot & arid AZ with an extremely oily T zone and insanely dry outer perimeter of my face. Not gonna lie, it leaves your face greasy but with visible results in the morning!!!! I've tried numerous thick moisturizers and nothing works like this one! Hydrated and doesn't break me out either. I use the OG cream in the morning & rich cream at night ‚ù§Ô∏è Please don't ever stop making these creams! * I never used to use a hydrator expecting that my moisturizer would do the job but after 40, my skin kept getting drier and no matter how much expensive moisturizer I used, it never felt hydrated. Enter using a hydrator recommend by a dermatologist. I use a serum, hydrator and then my moisturizer. Game changer. I started with the Clinique one but this is superior in my opinion. Try it. Your thirsty skin will thank you! * I would recommend to anyone. * I've been using the OG water drench facial moisturizer for 5+ years. I have very sensitive combo skin, and while the original formula is great for spring, summer and fall, i get more dry in the winter and need to supplement with a heavier moisturizer or even a lighter oil applied every other day. I thought this would be perfect - the heavier counterpart of my HG! It even has squalene, which is one of the oils i've had success with! This moisturizer has a much heavier feel, which i somewhat expected, but it doesn't absorb into my skin well. A little goes a long way. I haven't tried using this during the day, and don't think that would work well. Using at night, the following morning my skin still feels like there is something "on" it, preventing air from getting to my skin. This should be fine, especially in my ancient, dry house. Unfortunately, after two weeks of use, my pores are clogging and exacerbating my usually mild hormonal acne - turning red spots into fully-developed whiteheads. If i hadn't purchased this in a set i would likely have returned it, but i'll keep it for intermittent use if i get a particularly dry patch, it should be good for that. The ingredients are not irritating, so i will still call this safe for sensitive skin. If you have very dry skin that likes oil, this may work for you. However this product is more emollient than moisturizing, so imo skip if you have oily, seasonal combo, or acne-prone skin. * I love the original cloud drench moisturizer, so I thought I would love this one as well. To my surprise, my skin was only getting worse. It was starting to burn and itch. I've been allergy tested, and I don't have any. I don't know if Origins is using the oils from grapefruit, lemon and orange for fragrance purposes, but it does not list anywhere that they have extracted the furanocoumarins. After meeting with my dermatologist, I was advised that the citrus oils used in the sunscreen caused photosensitivity, and burned/ irritated my skin. If you are someone with darker or sensitive skin, I HIGHLY recommend AVOIDING this.

Name: green apple age defy moisturizer
supermello hyaluronic gel cream
comments:
* Seriously, the greatest of all time. I have dry, sensitive skin that's prone to rosacea and this has been a life saver. It's gentle and leaves my skin feeling soft, smooth and soothed. It's an added bonus that it smells delicious. * This is a great product for my dry, sensitive, and maturing skin. I more than likely will not purchase again. Bought 3 times before yall went and raised the price by $14. Not worth the price IMO. I feel there are better products for that price point. * I got this to keep my face from getting dry this winter. It works very well so far. The only thing I question is the fragrance, which is delightful, but probably not so good for my skin. * I wanted to love this product! The smell/texture is lovely.

Unfortunately, while sporting a "clean ingredients" tag and a tag from the national eczema association, I found the product to be highly irritating when I had a flare up. I only used it once during that time, and then after taking a second look at the ingredients, I found out that "phenoxyethanol" is a known potential allergen, irritant, potential endocrine disruptor, and the manufacturing process is highly polluting. In other countries the "safe" threshold for this ingredient is 1%, but it's hard to determine how much one is exposed to if applying daily/multiple times a day. Of course, there is no such regulation in US, so who knows how much is in this cream. 

At the same time I bought this, I tried products from cocokind which I highly recommend! They have a great price point and really are "clean" from what I have used so far, although one should always do their own research. While I was still having an eczema episode, I found using a homemade oatmeal paste + cocokind's chia seed oil was very helpful to get me through the dry itchiness. 

TLDR: not a clean product, could be irritating, check out cocokind. * I've been being treated for cancer for about a year and a half, now. Almost 6 months of that has been chemotherapy. Most products cause acne and rashes on my skin, since being on treatment. 
Pros: Did not irritate my overly sensitive skin. Smells good. I don't understand all the complaints about the smell. It is light and nice. It is kind of like marshmallows, but better. 

Cons: it moisturizes, but not enough while going through chemo. It feels great when I first put it on. But, after a few hours my skin feels tight again. Kind of like how vaseline can trick you into thinking your skin is moisturized at first. Hours later the surface of your skin feels tight and dry like a sunburn ready to peel. 

For the price, thete are much better options. Philosophy moisturizers are a lottle cheaper and give better longer lasting results for me in terms of moisture. * This is my 3rd time repurchasing this moisturizer. Unreal/ must try! * I do not want my face smelling like vanilla frosting but it did the whole time I used this. My fault but I'd literally have to hold my breath

Like a lot of Kiehl's products but won't buy this one again. * I've been using this moisturizer for about a year now and I swear by it. I put it on in the morning before applying my makeup and it works perfectly. I've found that some moisturizers make my foundation look kinda wonky, but my makeup goes on top of this one nicely. Also, I have sensitive skin and I have had no problems with this product. I'm never going back!

Name: hydrating moisturizing cream body moisturizer
comments: * My go to for when im feeling dry - doesnt leave you too greasey but for the first few minutes you will stay a little greasy. Example, if i use my computer mouse pad it will leave it greasey. * I am into very very dry skin. Its greasy n geavy when applied. A big Nooo * I am into very very dry skin. Its greasy n geavy when applied. A big Nooo * I had a compromised skin barrier and flaky skin and I used this as a final layer in my skincare to lock in moisture. I wish I would've started with this in the beginning of fall. Highly recommend for very dry skin. I didn't love the texture on my body but would highly recommend for the face at night. * Fixed my winter lizard skin. Will be buying again and again * I started using retinol months ago, and my skin was so irritated that I had to put moisturizer on every hour to not be in pain. My dermatologist gave me a sample of the Cetaphil cream and I love it. I repackage it in a squeeze bottle for easier application. * I have sensitive, dry, acne prone skin and this moisturizer is great! It is truly frangrance free: no chemical smell, just completely neutral. It is not greasy and it absorbs quickly. I like that it's in a tub so there's no product wasted.

Name: pure vitamin c anti-wrinkle firming moisturizing filler
comments: * This product goes on so smooth. Just enough of moisture. Really like it. * Not too greasy, perfect for combination skin. I use this for daytime care in conjunction with the Redermic R in the evening. It's a great combo ! * I use Redermic C every morning as my moisturizer. Name: aqua bomb brightening vitamin c cream
comments:
* First, the packaging is misleading for these lotions. The lotion inside is only as wide as the narrow part of the cap. Im not sure why they have this packaged like a big tub of lotion when its not. They should save the extra unnecessary packaging and also not have it be so misleading. 
The lotion itself isnt great - i have very slightly sensitive skin and this lotion makes my redness come out. Will not be repurchasing * belif has just never been a brand to let me down. I can't believe I had never tried this moisturizer though! It's so soft and pillowy and hydrates the skin beautifully. It sits so well under Makeup and has this soft but heavenly smell. I mean from the first try, thus knocked everything else out for me. I 1000%  recommend. * This moisturizer worked for my face and gave me a little glow. I am disappointed that it's not sold in stores anymore. * I'm VERY picky about moisturizers, and my skin tends to be slightly acne-prone but is also extremely dehydrated. I've used the Aqua Bomb from this brand and LOVED it, so the Vitamin C was a must-try. It has the silkiest texture, and absorbs beautifully into the skin while also leaving it looking and feeling plump and bouncy. I did notice that my post-acne marks cleared up much more quickly with this, and it didnt seem to exacerbate existing acne while providing me with deep hydrating through the winter months. If you are oily, this may not be for you, but for me it was a 10/10! * Smells like iced lemon sugar cookie. Feels veey light on the skin and not oily. * I was very excited to try out this product bc of hearing great things and hoping that it would help lighten hyperpigmentation that I have on my face but after using it for a few months it did absolutely nothing. Its very light wieght and gives you a glow. Just disappointed. * I love the fresh scent and feel of this lotion. I look forward to using this each morning.

Name: am oil control moisturizer with broad spectrum spf 30 mineral sunscreen
comments: * They gave me an EXPIRED PRODUCT?? So I ordered 10/14/25 and the expiration date just says 2025/10 likeee? Unbeknownst to me id been using expired product on my face. :((. It worked great at first then started irritating my skin horribly. Good product when its not expired omg. * Needed something that wouldn't feel heavy and still be able to help with excessive oil. Definitely works and budget friendly * I had high hopes for this, but was very disappointed. I am pretty pale and the white cast from this was so intense it was almost blue. Texture is also thick and sticky and all-around horrible. I have oily skin, and looked oilier than normal very early in the day. It also pilled up under my makeup throughout the day. I would give zero stars if I could. * Not for ppl with tan skin, definitely leaves a white cast which is hard to blend out, did just ok for my oiliness still had to use blotting sheets after a few hours but not as much, but i mean for the price it's decent. Careful not to apply too much otherwise it gets flaky?? Pea sized amount for the whole face is what you're aiming. * made me look like the walking dead the white cast was so bad. took about 15 -20 minutes to sink in my skin and did not sit well with my makeup. pilled throughout the day every time I wore it. you are probably thinking I used to much by this review but I use a pea size each on both my cheeks and forehead, and a pea sized amount total on my nose, chin and around my mouth. it's about . 25 of an ounce. * I never leave reviews but I was really disappointed in this product. It had a white cast, peeled off my skin, didnt help with oil control, and made me break out. * i like this product but I dont like it enough to repurchase. While this product works very well to control oip it works a bit too well and by that I mean that it drys the crap out of my face. Like drier than the desert. and the white cast is something!! I go to blend in the products and you need some elbow grease to get it to blend in. if you sweat the products turns white on your face.
